intro: Yucca roezlii, commonly known as the Rosel's yucca, is a species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its tall, fibrous stems and narrow, sword-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers during the summer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils. Yucca roezlii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a hardy plant in desert landscapes.
